result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramsy R White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>2500-10,000g) [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)4.
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges on both counts.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Obtain an HSED, or GED.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring at 3 months in jail and  3 months Electronic monitor, if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration.  Report within 60 days for start date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Comply with same conditions as Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramsy R White

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC dated 11/13/15 with Judge Response

1:57 p.m Defendant Ramsy R White in court with attorney Gregory J. Jerabek. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report.  Atty Jerabek states some corrections to the PSI report. ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. W/H Sentence: 36 mo probation w/conditions and conditional jail time.  Atty Jerabek concurs in part, but requests conditional jail to be served mostly on electronic monitor and obtain his HSED, GED.
Defendant makes apologetic statements.
BY THE COURT:*****PROBATION***
Count 1: W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation.
Conditions:
6 months Conditional Jail,  Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring at 3 months in jail and  3 months Electronic monitor, if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration.
- Pay costs and DNA surcharges on each counts. Report within 60 days to start.
  - Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
  - Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  - AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
- Obtain an HSED, or GED.

Appeal rights provided.

8:38 a.m. Defendant Ramsy R White in court with attorney Gregory J. Jerabek. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Request for PSI. State to cap recommendation to W/H Sentence 36 mo Probation w/conditions for counts 1 & 5. Counts 2, 3, & 4 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Counts 1 & 5 Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Dismissed and Read In Count 2, 3, & 4.
Atty Jerabek will go to br 2 to get Sentencing Date.

BY THE COURT:****PSI Report ordered.

Defendant Ramsy R White in court with attorney Gregory J. Jerabek. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:25 pm. Atty Cousins calls case.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.

Defendant Ramsy R White in court with attorney Gregory J. Jerabek. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.


NOT GUILTY plea entered on Count 4.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Constable recommends a cash bond with conditions as stated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
